title: A Republican Senator tried to embarrass Kamala Harris on the Senate floor... It backfired HORRIBLY

transcripts.text: so I will I'm happy to entertain a question from the senator from Texas and then Iâ€™ll I'll conclude my comments

thank you madam president I wonder if the senator would tell me the bill that the police act that it sounds like the Democratic conference intends to block tomorrow includes the anti lynching legislation that you and senator Booker have championed are you aware of that
the same one that Rand Paul's obstructed a couple weeks ago yes I am aware of that
so you're gonna block miss madam president so the Senators are gonna block their own anti-lynching bill by their vote tomorrow

absolutely not and I think that it is important that we not distract the American people from the task at hand we cannot pull out a specific component of this bill and and leave everything else in the garbage bin and that is the logical and actual and practical conclusion of where you're going with the suggestion that we would sacrifice issues like no-knock warrants issues like national standard for use of force issues like the need for independent investigations of police misconduct issues like pattern and practice investigations with subpoena power for the United States Department of Justice in sake of one it's like asking a mother save one of your children and leave the others
Madam President would the senator yield for another question

miss Madam President is the senator certainly as familiar with the rules of the Senate which allow senators to offer amendments to improve legislation once we get on it but if the Democratic conference is going to prevent the Senate from actually getting on the bill there's no opportunity for anyone any senator you or any one of us to offer amendments to improve it and I would further ask the senator aren't you aware of the fact that there are 60 vote thresholds on the back end so that if we get on the bill and you don't like the way it turns out you can block it on the back end but are the senator aware of those options that she has

well senator Cornyn you and I both serve and we are honored to serve on the Senate Judiciary Committee as does senator Booker Senator Durbin we all serve on the Judiciary Committee the two Senate authors of this bill serve with you on the Senate Judiciary Committee as you know because we've been present together during our most recent hearings we have asked that there would be a meaningful discussion of the justice and policing Act in that committee none has occurred so if we're going to talk about process let us look at all the tools that are available to well-intentioned well-meaning legislators if the goal is actually to solve and address the issue at hand I've seen no evidence of that I've seen no evidence of in fact what I've seen reading some of the newspapers sometimes they get things wrong but if they got it right the Senate leader said that he has no interest in engaging in that kind of discussion or debate before putting the the bill on the floor for a vote tomorrow

Madam President may I ask one last question of the senator what I'm trying to fathom Madam President is why the senator would rather have these negotiations occur behind closed doors as opposed to here on the floor of the Senate for the American people to see broadcast on television don't you think that sort of interaction and debate and negotiation out in front of all 330 million Americans would be beneficial to healing our country and coming to some consensus about what the appropriate reforms should be
indeed that is the beauty of the Judiciary Committee our meetings our public meetings I will now conclude my remarks by saying that

if that wasn't the longest 10 seconds of Senator Cornyn's life I don't know what was now what's happening here is that Republican John Cornyn is trying to troll Kamala Harris for not supporting the Senate's watered down policing reform legislation called the Justice Act by reminding her that her own sponsored legislation the anti-lynching bill was included now clearly Republicans included this legislation so they could do exactly this so they could say Oh Democrats aren't even supporting their own bill here's the thing you can't stick a carrot into a garbage bill and expect that that'll do the trick you're not going to trick Kamala Harris into supporting it because they made one tiny concession and second if Republicans actually cared about the anti-lynching legislation that they're using as a prop to advance their own bill it would be law right now but it's not because Republican Rand Paul blocked its unanimous passage and that should tell you everything you need to know about the GOPs commitment to making lynching a federal crime now Republicans are trying to frame this whole thing as the Democrats not being willing to advance police reform legislation and that's because the Senate legislation drafted by Republicans is inadequate there is no change to qualified immunity protections which shields police officers from accountability for misconduct which is at the heart of the protest nor does it establish a federal ban on chokeholds again which is at the heart of these protests so it's not that Democrats aren't taking police reforms seriously it's that the bill put forward by Republicans doesn't take police reform seriously and it's not worth it's a debate a bill on police reform that doesn't actually accomplish police reform Republicans are banking on this idea that all they had to do is throw some half-baked piece of legislation together without actually including any meaningful reforms they're banking on the idea that the American people are stupid and won't actually bother learning what's in the bill and that we're all just blindly gonna cheer on Republicans because they introduced a bill called the Justice Act and so clearly that must mean they take it seriously in reality not only do we know what's in this bill and therefore know that they don't take it seriously but the fact that they're playing games while hundreds of thousands of Americans have taken to the streets demanding change goes to show just how much of a joke they think this is if the GOP cared they'd have listened to the American people they'd have included an end to qualified immunity and ban chokehold and the use of no-knocks warrants and drug cases instead all the Republican bill does is tie some funding to police departments that volunteer to ban chokeholds and to study data on no-knock warrants to claim this as toothless is an understatement so instead of cooking up stunts to try and embarrass Democrats Republicans might want to consider actually taking steps to reform the very real problem of policing in the United States by the way that's a position that nearly two-thirds of Americans share so the fact that the GOP still still can't manage to do something about it goes to show that their priority is not the will of the American people but rather dragging their feet and playing games and hoping that we eventually forget but the thing is we won't forget and with an election coming up in November it's only going to give an outlet to the millions of Americans who've taken to the streets in protest these last few weeks to voice their anger and achieve some change if you like that video please check out my brand new podcast no lie with Brian Tyler Cohen where I'll cover the most important political stories of the week and interview major players in the world of politics available now on Apple podcast Spotify or wherever you get your podcasts check it out and subscribe now
